SENT.plain: A new case of congenital contracture arachnodactyly (CCA) revealed in the neonatal period is reported
CCA is a dominantly inherited syndrome associating arachnodactyly, kyphoscoliosis, multiple congenital joint contractures and crumpled ears
This condition differs from Marfan's syndrome by the usual absence of visceral involvement, although cardiac complications are possible
The neonatal forms result from new mutations are are generally severe
